result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee S. Krolow

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Lee S. Krolow in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. still wishes to attain counsel. Court is in agreeance and finds good cause to go past time limits. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lee S. Krolow
Current: 888 E. Shady Ln #176, Neenah, WI   (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 1928 W. College Ave, Appleton, WI 54914

No contact with victim or victims residence.
Defendant not try to sell or transfer property located at N7652 Pine St. Eland WI.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

2:44 PM Defendant Lee S. Krolow in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed Atty or represent self. Def. wishes to attain counsel and Court orders Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.  State is in compliance with victim rights. State recommends $500.00 cash bond with conditions that Def. have no contact with victim and that he not try to sell or transfer property located at N7652 Pine St. Eland WI. State believes cash bond is necessary and appropriate as well as conditions. Court reviews criminal complaint. Def. makes statement regarding bond. State reviews Def. prior record and is not aware of any prior record. Court reviews 3 factors in setting bond and sets signature bond in the amount of $500.00 with conditions of no contact with the alleged victim or their residence and to not transfer or attempt to transfer property located at N7652 Pine St. Eland, WI. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
